locutie.beschrijving: A meta-homiletical reflection on the loss of God's agency in mainline preaching, using Deutero-Isaiah as the corrective model of God as the acting subject.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High; focuses on the grammatical and theological priority of God's sovereignty in the exilic context.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher is primarily ASSERTING a theological crisis and then COMMENDING a return to Isaiah, concluding with a shift to DECLARING God's presence.
voorbeelden: I speak with a certain amount of authority when I say...
I quite seriously propose that a strong dose of Second Isaiah is what we all need.
May the Holy One of Israel... confirm his Word in you all.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Conviction of the clergy regarding their own 'constative surplus' and a renewed confidence in God's active power.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the sermon relies on the Word's own power (Isa 55) rather than explicit pneumatological invocation.

voorbeelden: The subject in so much of our preaching is ourselves.
Isaiah is living in a civilization that is utterly foreign.
Lift up your eyes on high and see.
What saddened me was that my luncheon companion knew this.
I am still baffled by this response.
I will strengthen you, I will help you.
I will give you as a light to the nations.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong, but largely quoted from Scripture rather than formulated as the preacher's own direct promise to the congregation.

voorbeelden: May the God who is the subject of the verb act to strengthen you.
May he give you such joy.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher uses the optative 'May' which functions as a liturgical blessing/declaration of reality.

indicatoren: Extensive anecdotal evidence about other sermons
Theological lecture on the 'subject of the verb'
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is educated about the need for performative preaching but is not immediately 'performed upon' until the very end.

missende_elementen: Direct commissioning of the specific clergy present
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Hearers remain in the role of 'students of homiletics' rather than 'subjects of God's action' for the majority of the text.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High theological quality, though mediated through the prophet Isaiah.
voorbeelden: He has promised to make himself present in our announcements.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and homiletical observations ('I have heard').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the clergy ('You may think', 'I say to you').

derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'teaching' atmosphere where God is discussed as a concept/subject of study.

actueel_present.gebruik: The closing blessing and the 'now' of the American church.

foutief_patroon.probleem: The sermon avoids moralism (Directive), but stays long in Assertives.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from Asserting the problem to Declaring the promise of God's Word in the closing.
voorbeelden: God has put his message into the mouths of mere human beings... [therefore] May the Holy One... confirm his Word in you.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is late but powerful.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: God is the subject... [therefore] lift up your voice with strength.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The text explicitly identifies as 'more a teaching than a sermon.' It diagnoses the lack of performative agency in others while itself remaining largely constative until the peroration.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: God is the subject of the verbs.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a clear mental model for the hearers.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Extensive stories about New York lunches and hearing sermons in Maine.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Delays the 'event' of the Word in favor of 'talking about' the Word.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is an 'event' of realization for the clergy, but the 'event' of God's presence is mostly quoted from the past rather than enacted in the present.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts as a teacher of the sacrament rather than the administrator of the sacrament for the first 80% of the text.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Central theme; the preacher argues that God must be the speaker.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Explicitly stated: 'God has put his message into the mouths of mere human beings.'
tekstueel_bewijs: He has promised to make himself present in our announcements.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low; the focus is on the 'Word' and the 'Verb' rather than the Spirit's perlocutionary work.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicit in the quote of Isaiah 55:11 regarding the Word not returning empty.
tekstueel_bewijs: It shall accomplish that which I purpose.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Strongly affirmed in theory, moderately enacted in practice.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'I have heard' and 'Isaiah says' (Assertives). It needs more 'God does' and 'I declare to you' (Declaratives).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The thing about those churches... is that there is a sense of a living God.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In this moment, the living God is here, acting upon you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from describing a 'sense' to enacting a 'presence'.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promises are mostly 'quoted' from Isaiah rather than 'spoken' by the preacher to the congregation.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use direct address for the promises.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you, ordained servants, God says: I have chosen you and not cast you off.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time spent on 'the clergy' (3rd person) instead of 'you' (2nd person).
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the listeners' specific 'furnace of affliction' earlier.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the witnesses Isaiah speaks of.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually good, as the preacher avoids legalism.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A brilliant theological diagnosis of the 'constative surplus' in modern preaching, which successfully breaks into performative power in its final movements.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (the New York lunch), SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the Word to change the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The sermon moves beyond 'persuading' the clergy to 'blessing' them, shifting from rhetorical appeal to illocutionary force.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the preacher's thesis ('God as the subject of the verb') is only fully realized when the preacher himself stops 'talking about' God and starts 'speaking for' God.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God is the subject of the verbs.
May the God who is the subject of the verb act to strengthen you.
kernzinnen_analyse.illocutionaire_kracht: Mediating God's strength to the hearer.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a 'performative contradiction' in the first half—talking about the need for God to be the subject while the preacher's 'I' is the primary subject—but it resolves beautifully in the scriptural citations and benediction.
